She stared at the red bead forming, then watched it drip onto the cutting board, staining the pristine white of the chopped onions. A sob escaped her, echoing through the empty house, as despair settled heavy in her chest.

I could hear his voice in my head, "Maria, you're making a mountain out of a molehill." But I couldn't help it. My mind was already racing, "This is it. This is the start. First the cut, then an infection, then who knows what else? I can't handle this alone."
